solution.text:
Given the area \(= \frac 12 \times Width \times\) (Sum of parallel sides)
\(= \frac 12 \times _{k}_ \times (_{j}_ +\) River Side Length\()\)
Therefore River Side Length = \(\frac{_{{Decimal('0.5')*k*(j+60)}}_}{_{{Decimal('0.5')*k}}_} - _{j}_\)
\(= 60 m\)

content.text: Hussain bought a plot of agricultural land which is in the shape of a trapezium (see below). The area of the land is \(_{{Decimal('0.5')*k*(j+60)}}_ m^2\), the side parallel to the road is _{j}_ metres and the width of the field is _{k}_ metres. How long is the side parallel to the river in metres?
